it.emarolab.scene_identification_tracking.semanticSceneLibrary.objects.aMOR

Class MORDescriptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.emarolab.scene_identification_tracking.semanticSceneLibrary.objects.Semantics.Base
      • it.emarolab.scene_identification_tracking.semanticSceneLibrary.objects.aMOR.MORDescriptor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Semantics.Descriptor<it.emarolab.amor.owlInterface.OWLReferences,org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLNamedIndividual>, Semantics.Logger

    public class MORDescriptor
extends Semantics.Base
implements Semantics.Descriptor<it.emarolab.amor.owlInterface.OWLReferences,org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLNamedIndividual>
    The aMOR interface to manipulate an OWLOntology and give a semantic to a Semantics.Primitive object.

    Each instance of this class should be assigned to the description of an object. Indeed, it is a container describing:

    • the OWL ontology (as an OWLReferences), retrieved by name. This representation is the one in which the related object will be mapped (read/write).
    • an OWL Individual, defined by name, that semantically describes the related object.

    REMARK: see here for more about the aMOR library.

    File: it.emarolab.scene_identification_tracking.semanticSceneLibrary.objects.Semantics

    date: 06/01/2017
    See Also:
    Semantics, Semantics.Descriptor, MORPrimitive, MOR3DArray

      • setOntology

        public void setOntology(java.lang.String ontoName)
        Set an OWLReferences able to manipulate and query an OWL ontology. It is retrieved by name, given as input parameter, that must be already available into the aMOR library.
        Parameters:
        ontoName - the name of an instantiated OWLReferences that describes the OWL Ontology containing the object described by this class

        Parameters:
        individualName - the name of the new OWL individual describing the related object.

      • writeLiteral

        public Semantics.WritingState writeLiteral(java.lang.String debuggingInfo,
                                           org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLDataProperty property,
                                           org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLLiteral javaLiteral)
        It uses the TryingWrite#perform() interface for synchronise a literal (the value of an OWLDataProperty) from a java representation (the object related to this descriptor) into the getOntology() (indeed the value will be written to: getIndividual()).

        In particular, it:

        • reads the value of a property and, if it does not exists, it creates a new axiom in the ontology by mapping a java representation. In this case it returns an Semantics.WritingState#ADDED state.
        • otherwise, if the value of the previous point exists. It checks if it is semanticLiteral.equals( javaLiteral) to the java representation. If their are not equal, it does not perform any ontological changes and returns a Semantics.WritingState#NOT_CHANGED state.
        • If it is not the case, it synchronise the OWL ontology with respect to the java representation and returns an Semantics.WritingState#UPDATED state.

        REMARK: the first point check for a value relate to a semantic data property. If the same individual has more than one value for the same property this implementation does not assure any rule on the used value.

        Parameters:
        debuggingInfo - a string used for debugging logging.
        property - the OWL data property to be used to semantically write a value to an individual
        javaLiteral - the literal to be mapped in the individual (in the ontology) defined by this descriptor.
        Returns:
        the state of the writing of a OWL data property value.
        See Also:
        TryingWrite

      • readLiteral

        public MORDescriptor.ReadingOutcome readLiteral(java.lang.String debuggingInfo,
                                                org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLDataProperty property,
                                                org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLLiteral javaValue)
        It uses the TryingRead#perform() interface for synchronise a java representation (the object related to this descriptor) from a literal (the value of an OWLDataProperty) into the getOntology() (indeed the value will be written to: getIndividual()).

        In particular, it:

        • reads the value of a property and, if it does not exists, In this case it returns an Semantics.ReadingState#ABSENT state through the MORDescriptor.ReadingOutcome container (reading buffer will be set to null).
        • otherwise, if the value of the previous point exists. It checks if it is semanticValue.equals( javaValue) to the java representation. If it is the case, it does not perform any changes in the java description and returns a Semantics.WritingState#NOT_CHANGED state (though MORDescriptor.ReadingOutcome with the value get from the ontology in the buffer).
        • If their are not equal, it synchronise the java representation with the value read from the OWL ontology and returns an Semantics.WritingState#UPDATED state.
        Parameters:
        debuggingInfo - a string used for debugging logging.
        property - the OWL data property to be used to semantically read the value from the individual
        javaValue - the value to be mapped in the java representation from the ontology.
        Returns:
        the state of the reading of an OWL data property value.
        See Also:
        TryingRead, MORDescriptor.ReadingOutcome
